README.md:
# tensor-subspace-norm Minimize the subspace norm for tensor decomposition. Run `test.m` for a demo. #### Sample output ``` [iter 1] fval=3620.5 gap=Inf fact=0.0856754 viol=[21.1281 21.1278 21.128 0 0 0 0 0 0 ...0] [iter 2] fval=204.603 gap=0.730738 fact=0.890277 viol=[14.0473 14.0476 14.0475 0 0 0 0 0 0 ...0] [iter 3] fval=108.684 gap=0.103087 fact=1 viol=[2.35363 2.35403 2.35381 0 0 0 0 0 0 ...0] [iter 4] fval=105.982 gap=0.0140033 fact=1 viol=[0.395231 0.395059 0.395124 0 0 0 0 0 0 ...0] [iter 5] fval=105.903 gap=0.00224953 fact=1 viol=[0.0683447 0.0671456 0.0677576 0 0 0 0 0 0 ...0] [iter 6] fval=105.9 gap=0.000667203 fact=0.998896 viol=[0.015317 0.0131444 0.0144715 0 0 0 0 0 0 ...0] subspace norm :: sigma = 8.034e-02 lambda = 1.000e+00 relative error = 0.072904 ``` #### Reference Interpolating Convex and Non-Convex Tensor Decompositions via the Subspace Norm, NIPS 2015
Qinqing Zheng, Ryota Tomioka
[[nips-version]](http://papers.nips.cc/paper/5823-interpolating-convex-and-non-convex-tensor-decompositions-via-the-subspace-norm) [[arxiv-version]](http://arxiv.org/abs/1503.05479) [[poster]](http://people.cs.uchicago.edu/~qinqing/tensor_nips15.pdf)
